title: Bad evaluation
body:
Hi @lufficc, i've trained model on a subset of coco with only 4 classes instead of 80 and 1600 images. This is my configuration:
MODEL:
  NUM_CLASSES: 5
  BACKBONE:
    OUT_CHANNELS: (512, 1024, 512, 256, 256, 256, 256)
  PRIORS:
    FEATURE_MAPS: [64, 32, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1]
    STRIDES: [8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512]
    MIN_SIZES: [20.48, 51.2, 133.12, 215.04, 296.96, 378.88, 460.8]
    MAX_SIZES: [51.2, 133.12, 215.04, 296.96, 378.88, 460.8, 542.72]
    ASPECT_RATIOS: [[2], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2], [2]]
    BOXES_PER_LOCATION: [4, 6, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4]
INPUT:
  IMAGE_SIZE: 512
DATASETS:
  TRAIN: ("coco_2017_train", )
  TEST: ("coco_2017_val", )
SOLVER:
  MAX_ITER: 100000
  LR_STEPS: [85000, 120000]
  GAMMA: 0.1
  BATCH_SIZE: 4
  LR: 1e-4

OUTPUT_DIR: 'outputs/vgg_ssd512_coco_4class100000iter'

TEST:
  BATCH_SIZE: 1
  CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD: 0.01
  MAX_PER_CLASS: -1
  MAX_PER_IMAGE: 100
  NMS_THRESHOLD: 0.01
I've trained it with 100000 iterations and the evaluation results are:
AP        : 0.011
AP50      : 0.015
AP75      : 0.013
APs       : 0.006
APm       : 0.004
APl       : 0.014

I think there are problems on resizing boxes when evaluating, because in "bbox.json" i see a lot of boxes with negative coordinates. Someone can help me please?
